intro: Sida quettensis, commonly known as the African mallow, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of the Middle East. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with a rough texture and produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is known for its fibrous stems, which have been used traditionally for various purposes.
